title: How to Make a Custom Music Mix (for Cheer or Dance)

steps.headline: Get with the program.
steps.description: Download a music editing program. There are some great ones out there. Audacity is one that runs on Mac, PC, and Linux, and other operating systems—and it's free!

steps.headline: Find a few different songs that go well together.
steps.description: Let your team members help pick the songs. Look for songs that have a similar beat or feel, or look for songs that are timed to the tempo of your routines.

steps.headline: Open the songs in your sound editor.
steps.description: At the same time, create a new blank sound document. Find the pieces in each song that you want to use. Cut each piece, in order and place into the empty sound file.

steps.headline: Add sound effects!
steps.description: You can buy CDs or download thousands of sound effects to add flavor to your cheer routine. Cut these and overlay them in various places of your music.

steps.headline: Timing is everything!
steps.description: Make sure the finished music meets your requirements. Listen through your mix with your teammates, and see what they think. After you do a couple of these, it'll be second nature!

steps.headline: Burn to a CD.
steps.description: Congratulations, you just made a great mix, and now it's time to use it. Make copies for your friends, pass them out, and get your team on the floor!

tyn: Music (either on the computer or on CD's)
Music editing software (some can be downloaded for free)
CD's to burn the finished music on.
